meanings.sent1: After heating the gas, it started condensing into a liquid.
meanings.sent2: The chef was condensing the sauce to make it thicker and more flavorful.
meanings.sent3: The students were amazed by how quickly the fog was condensing into dew on the grass.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like a storm cloud, condensing and darkening with each passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion required condensing the ingredients to unleash its full power.

meanings.definition: Express (a piece of writing or speech) in fewer words.
meanings.sent1: She was condensing the report to fit it all on one page.
meanings.sent2: The editor was condensing the article to meet the word count limit.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so condensed that the audience couldn't stop laughing.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like a poem, condensing all his feelings into a few simple words.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to condense their essays to focus on the main points.
